intro: Dasymaschalon acuminatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of a yellow disk surrounded by white ray florets. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing dune ecosystems.
